channel.title: Server help topic structure
channel.description:
Dear members of moparscape, I know a lot of you want to get helped with things you don't understand of errors you never had before. Atleast I do. But I have seen a lot of members keep posting the same error like 3 times. My purpose is to create somewhat of a topic structure. [u][b]Topic Structure:[/b][/u]
Server base: "Your server base" (this is for example delta) Revision: "Your revision" (for example 317) Type of problem: "What kind of problem" (First of all check if it's server sided or client sided. - client sided needs to be posted in the section client help. If it's server sided what kind of problem do you have. For example, compiler help, command help, ect. Description: "The description of your problem." (Please describe it the best you can. This will make it much easier for the members that want to help you.) Pictures: "post a picture for the best chance of getting helped.
EXAMPLE: Server base: Delta Revision: 317 Type of problem: Compiler error Description: I have 100 errors when I compile. Pictures: None needed for this. [u][b]Title[/b][/u] Bad title: server not working delta HELP!!!!! Better title: Food handling error in Delta Ideal title: Error handling food item actions while in combat, Delta Please describe like in the above titel some basic information like the base and somewhat what kind of error. I know some members will say that this probably is not good. I just wrote this to make it much easier for people to get helped. I hope some will use this and get better results. Thank you for reading, halflive9 Note: I'm still adding some things.

item.title: Server help topic structure
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

  1. All topic bodies must follow this post.
    There is something on this anyways…

Read full topic

item.title: Server help topic structure
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:21, topic:428856”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=531552.msg3883951#msg3883951 date=1326290918]
I don’t think this will be used at all. It never hurts to try though.
[/quote]
This. Though it is a good idea, no one wants to take the time to fill one of these out every post. Plus, 90% of the posts in here are made by ignorant people that don’t know how to code so how would they know what title to put?[/quote]
They can put like compiler error [delta] or something. It’s not that hard. I know all those new members that just want to get helped as fast as possible with half assed threads. It’s just time that they actually give us enough information.

Read full topic

I don’t think this will be used at all. It never hurts to try though.

item.title: Server help topic structure
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

Attempts have been made before but they failed. Now i’m trying again to get this in the community. This will not be a one day work but take some weeks maybe more than a month? unless it fails which will be if the topic dies.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help topic structure
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

killerkody:

If players keep making backups after they update there server they would not run into errors when they mess up! Keep that in mind!

They would still run into errors when they mess up, they would just have something to return to if they did mess up.

Davidi2:

I somewhat agree Zyle, except I think some of the more basic things could be implemented. For example, revision number and maybe base.

It would have to be a text field, otherwise a mod would have to add all of the different bases (Delta, PI, Project 16, Cheezescape, RuneSource, etc) manually. (Or have a semi-automatic script that adds it to a list when the player adds a different server).

Read full topic

item.title: Server help topic structure
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I somewhat agree Zyle, except I think some of the more basic things could be implemented. For example, revision number and maybe base.

item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_

@lemme_winks wrote:

i didnt read ur post. it doesn’t matter anyways because i added on to what you were saying.

item.title: Server help topic structure
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“lemme_winks_, post:14, topic:428856”]i’m not sure if SMF is as customizable/extensible as vbulletin, but vbulletin supports a form feature where instead of making a thread with the default topic creator, you have to fill out a form. the form would consist of many different questions such as:

your question
the snippet you are having trouble with
a snippet of what you TRIED to implement to fix the problem

…and answering these questions should be mandatory[/quote][quote=“zyle1992, post:13, topic:428856”]And if they implemented a new posting template, meaning a form with the various fields mentioned, people would complain and view asking for help as a chore.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Server help topic structure
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

i’m not sure if SMF is as customizable/extensible as vbulletin, but vbulletin supports a form feature where instead of making a thread with the default topic creator, you have to fill out a form. the form would consist of many different questions such as:

your question
the snippet you are having trouble with
a snippet of what you TRIED to implement to fix the problem

…and answering these questions should be mandatory

Read full topic

item.title: Server help topic structure
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Davidi2:

Tried this before. Nobody pays attention.

Exactly. While it would be an improvement, people would neglect it most of the time and still get the answers they want.

And if they implemented a new posting template, meaning a form with the various fields mentioned, people would complain and view asking for help as a chore.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help topic structure
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Tried this before. Nobody pays attention.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help topic structure
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

maybe moparscape should consider implementing a posting method similar to what stackoverflow does. however, even with that, this section still needs active moderators.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help topic structure
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:8, topic:428856”]Yes, it’s a good idea. It has tried to be implemented in the past, but the members simply didn’t read the rules, posted topics without the structure, and people still had their problems solved.

Indeed it would be a clear improvement if they were more clear in the topic titles.

Bad title:
server not working delta HELP!!!

Better title:
Food handling error in Delta

Ideal title:
Error handling food item actions while in combat, Delta[/quote]

Thank you, added to the topic.

[quote=“Native^, post:9, topic:428856”] Revision: "Your revision" (for example pi)
Errhh…? You probably mean 317, or 562.[/quote]
Yes, I fixed that.

Read full topic

item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

Dear members of moparscape,

I know a lot of you want to get helped with things you don’t understand of errors you never had before. Atleast I do. But I have seen a lot of members keep posting the same error like 3 times. My purpose is to create somewhat of a topic structure.

Topic Structure:

Server base: "Your server base" (this is for example delta) Revision: "Your revision" (for example 317) Type of problem: "What kind of problem" (First of all check if it's server sided or client sided. - client sided needs to be posted in the section client help. EXAMPLE:

Revision: 317

Title
